availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Gilchriest (Louisville, Kentucky, agent to return fugitives)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, iron moulder and agent. New York native. Married to Mary Dwyer Gilchriest in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on August 17, 1848. Father of James Gilchriest, Catherine Gilchriest, Cynthia Gilchriest, Thomas Gilchriest, and Minnie Gilchriest. Moulder in Louisville in 1850. Moulder in Louisville in 1860. Mentioned in correspondance regarding a fugitive in Indiana by Charles Glass in Louisville on February 9, 1863. Recommended as an agent to return a fugitive prisoner from Tennessee by Louisville police clerk J.B. Ehrich on December 29, 1864.
